main event: On February 25, 1956, a civilian witness observed a round object twice the diameter of a utility pole in Sahuarita, Arizona, during a ground-visual sighting that lasted for over an hour.
interesting points: The object was described as dark green, brown, or black, with no sound emitted., The trajectory of the object was towards the north., The U.S. Air Force concluded the sighting was a probable balloon, although there was no evidence to confirm a balloon was in the area., Witnesses reported watching the object for about 30 minutes before it moved out of sight over some hills., The sighting triggered various inquiries by the Air Force for further balloon tracking information.
sighted object: round object, twice the diameter of a utility pole
